jsongminer
Class MusicMetaData

java.lang.Object
  jsongminer.MusicMetaData
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class MusicMetaData
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Each object of this class holds a piece of metadata, including the field identifer for the metadata, the value itself of the metadata and the source from which the metadata value was derived.

Static methods are also included for processing collections of MusicMetaData objects in various ways.

See Also:

findFirstValidValueForFieldID

public static java.lang.String findFirstValidValueForFieldID(java.lang.String field_id_to_search_for,
                                                             java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> to_search)
Searches through the provided vector for the first MusicMetaData object with the given field identifier that has a non-null and non-empty string value.

Parameters:
field_id_to_search_for - The field identifier to search for.
to_search - The MusicMetaData objects to search through.
Returns:
The value of the first MusicMetaData object found meeting the required conditions. Null if none can be found.

cleanMusicMetaData

Remove all entries in the given data that have values of null or empty string.

Parameters:
to_clean - The MusicMetaData to clean.

removeDuplicateEntries

public static void removeDuplicateEntries(java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> to_clean)
Remove all duplicate entries in the given data. A duplicate entry is one that has the same values for all three public fields (source, field_identifier and value).

Parameters:
to_clean - The MusicMetaData to clean.

convertToJMIRData

public static ace.datatypes.SegmentedClassification convertToJMIRData(java.lang.String identifier,
                                                                      java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> to_convert,
                                                                      boolean url_encode)
                                                               throws java.lang.Exception
Return the given vector of metadata as a single ACE SegmentedClassification object with the metadata placed in a corresponding way in the misc_info_key and misc_info fields. The specified identifier is used as the instance identifier in this new SegmentedClassification object.

Parameters:
identifier - An identifier identifying what the given to_convert metadata refers to as a whole.
to_convert - The converted data. Null is returned if identifier is null or an empty string.
url_encode - Whether or not to URL encode (UTF-8) the data (in both misc_info_key and misc_info).
Returns:
An ACE SegmentedClassification object containing the data in to_convert.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if the data could not be properly URL encoded.

saveInACEXMLClassificationsFile

public static void saveInACEXMLClassificationsFile(java.lang.String[] identifier_keys,
                                                   java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> data_to_save,
                                                   boolean url_encode,
                                                   java.lang.String save_directory,
                                                   java.lang.String save_file_path)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
Save the provided MusicMetaData vector as an ACE XML 1.1 Classifications File containing a single instance with all of the MusicMetaData objects saved as misc_info. The instance identifier is found based on the the provided identifier_keys. The data_to_save parameter is searched for a MusicMetaData object with one of the identifier_keys (from start to finish of the array) as its field identifier. The value of the first matching MusicMetaData object is used as the identifier. This value is also used as the file name for the saved ACE XML file (with the .xml extension appended). If a file with the selected name already exists, then an underscore followed by a numerical value is appended to the end of the file name such that the name is unique.

Parameters:
identifier_keys - The candidate field identifiers to look for in the data_to_save in order to acquire the identifier string and filename. These are ranked from best to worse.
data_to_save - The data to save as an ACE XML file.
url_encode - Whether or not to URL encode (UTF-8) the saved data (in both misc_info_key and misc_info). If this is true, the file name will also be URL encoded.
save_directory - The directory to save the ACE XML file in.
save_file_path - The path of the file to save to. Ignored if null. If it is non-null, then it overrides all other settings.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An informative exception is thrown if the input parameters are invalid or if the file could not be saved.

saveInTextFile

public static void saveInTextFile(java.lang.String[] identifier_keys,
                                  java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> data_to_save,
                                  boolean url_encode,
                                  java.lang.String save_directory,
                                  java.lang.String save_file_path)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
Save the provided MusicMetaData vector as a text file where each odd line is a field identifier and each even line is the value for the field named on the preceding line.

The file name is found based on the the provided identifier_keys. The data_to_save parameter is searched for a MusicMetaData object with one of the identifier_keys (from start to finish of the array) as its field identifier. The value of the first matching MusicMetaData object is used as the file name (with the .txt extension appended). If a file with the selected name already exists, then an underscore followed by a numerical value is appended to the end of the file name such that the name is unique.

Parameters:
identifier_keys - The candidate field identifiers to look for in the data_to_save in order to acquire the filename. These are ranked from best to worse.
data_to_save - The data to save as a txt file.
url_encode - Whether or not to URL encode (UTF-8) the saved data. If this is true, the file name will also be URL encoded.
save_directory - The directory to save the file in.
save_file_path - The path of the file to save to. Ignored if null. If it is non-null, then it overrides all other settings.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An informative exception is thrown if the input parameters are invalid or if the file could not be saved.

convertACEXMLToText

public static java.lang.String convertACEXMLToText(java.lang.String ace_xml_path)
                                            throws java.lang.Exception
Convert the given ACE XML 1.1 Classifications file to the type of text file output by jSongMiner, which is to say field names (misc_info info_type attribute values) are put on odd lines and field values (misc_info element values) are put on the following even lines. The resultant string, including line breaks, is returned. URL decoding is not performed.

Parameters:
ace_xml_path - The path of the ACE XML 1.1 Classifications file to transalte.
Returns:
The text conversion of the contents of the ACE XML file.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An informative exceptino is thrown if a problem occurs.
